SEARCH
Module dbConnect
Package dbConnect

Class DBConnect

java.lang.Object
dbConnect.DBConnect
public class DBConnect extends Object
Database Connector class.
This class contains:
  • initialize() initialize DBConnect using default value.
  • initialize(String) initialize DBConnect for a local database server.
  • initialize(String, int, String, String) overload local connection with custom details.
  • initialize(String, String, int, String, String) initialize DBConnect with fully customizable details.
  • initCheck() check if DBConnect is initialized yet.
  • retrieve(Class, String, Object...) get certain data from a table.
  • retrieveAll(Class) get all data from a certain table.
  • insert(Object) insert data to a certain table.
  • update(Object) update data to a certain row in a table.
  • delete(Object) delete data from a certain row in a table.

  • Constructor Details

    • DBConnect

      public DBConnect()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public static void initialize()
      Initialization of Database connection.
      This overload fetch default value from ConnectorString.
      • host: localhost
      • database: store_db
      • port: 3306
      • user: root
      • password: root
      Initialize method should be call before all database query tasks.

    • initialize

      public static void initialize(String databaseName)
      Initialization of Database connection.
      This overload creates default connection to localhost.
      Default values:
      • host: localhost
      • port: 3306
      • user: root
      • password: root
      Initialize method should be call before all database query tasks.
      Parameters:
      databaseName - the Nameof the database.

    • initialize

      public static void initialize(String databaseName, int portNumber, String user, String password)
      Initialization of Database connection.
      This overload creates a connection to localhost.
      Default value:
      • host: localhost
      Initialize method should be called before all database query tasks.
      Parameters:
      databaseName - the Name of the database.
      portNumber - the Port of the database.
      user - the Username of database account.
      password - the Password of database account.

    • initialize

      public static void initialize(String host, String databaseName, int portNumber, String user, String password)
      Initialization of Database connection.
      This overload creates a connection to a database at a certain host.
      Initialize method should be call before all database queries task.
      Parameters:
      host - the address of the database's host machine.
      databaseName - the Name of the database.
      portNumber - the Port of the database.
      user - the Username of database account.
      password - the Password of database account.

    • retrieve

      public static <T> List<T> retrieve(Class<T> modelClass, String whereTerm, Object... params)
      A method to get data from the database. It uses the input class to determine what table to pull from.
      Function:
      - Invoke initCheck() to check if dbQuery is null or not, then create instance of RetrieveParser.
      - Invoke RetrieveParser.retrieve(Class, String, Object...)
      Parameters:
      modelClass - a user desired DataModel class.
      Call (DataModel.class).
      whereTerm - conditions on how to search, using ? as placeholders.
      params - value of mentioned conditions in order.
      Returns:
      List of the desired object. If no data is found, an empty list is returned.
      Throws:
      Exception - When there is error during retrieval of data.

    • retrieveAll

      public static <T> List<T> retrieveAll(Class<T> modelClass)
      A method to get data from the database. It uses the input class to determine what table to pull from. This method allows pulling all data of a model.
      Function:
      - Invoke initCheck() to check if dbQuery is null or not, then create instance of RetrieveParser.
      - Invoke RetrieveParser.retrieveAll(Class)
      Parameters:
      modelClass - a user desired DataModel class.
      Call (DataModel.class).
      Returns:
      List of the desired object. If no data is found, an empty list is returned.
      Throws:
      Exception - When there is error during retrieval of data.

    • insert

      public static <T> boolean insert(T model)
      A method to insert data to the database. It uses the input class to determine what table to push to.
      Function:
      - Invoke initCheck() to check if dbQuery is null or not, then create instance of InsertParser.
      - Invoke InsertParser.insert(Object)
      Parameters:
      model - a user desired dataModel object, carrying data that need to be inserted.
      Returns:
      true if insert successfully.
      false if insert failed.
      Insert successful state is determined by the inserted row count.
      Throws:
      Exception - When there is error during insert of data.

    • update

      public static <T> boolean update(T model)
      A method to update data to the database. It uses the input class to determine what row in a table to update.
      Function:
      - Invoke initCheck() to check if dbQuery is null or not, then create instance of UpdateParser.
      - Invoke UpdateParser.update(Object)
      Parameters:
      model - a user desired dataModel object, carrying data that need to be updated.
      Returns:
      true if update successfully.
      false if update failed.
      Update successful state is determined by the updated row count.
      Throws:
      Exception - When there is error during update of data.

    • delete

      public static <T> boolean delete(T model)
      A method to delete data to the database. It uses the input class to determine what row in a table to delete.
      Function:
      - Invoke initCheck() to check if dbQuery is null or not, then create instance of DeleteParser.
      - Invoke DeleteParser.delete(Object)
      Parameters:
      model - a user desired dataModel object, must contain at least the primary key field initiated.
      Returns:
      true if delete successfully.
      false if delete failed.
      delete successful state is determined by the deleted row count.
      Throws:
      Exception - When there is error during update of data.
